intro: Camaridium cedralense, commonly known as the Cedralense Camaridium, is a rare flowering plant native to the subtropical regions of Brazil. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within dense forests. Its flowering period occurs during the late spring and early summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
